paper_title.ja: 大学における新しいコンピュータリテラシー教育プログラムの展開
paper_title.en: Development of New Educational Program for Computer Literacy at University

description.ja: 本論文では，2004年度から段階的に開始された本学独自のコンピュータリテラシー教育の概要を述べるとともに，独自開発した自動採点ツールを，高校と大学，大学と民間の接続性を保証するコンピュータリテラシーの評価システムとして捉えることによって，シームレスな教育が実現可能であることを提起し，検証を行った．The purpose of this paper is to propose a new method of computer literacy at university by automatic marking system. This system which was developed at Sapporo Gakuin University is able to assess several assignments which students prepared by Microsoft Wo研究ノート

paper_title.ja: 多数円板の矩形内配置問題(振動制御法によるアプローチ)
paper_title.en: A Packing Problem of Many Circles into Rectangles (A New Approach by Vibration Control Method)

description.ja: This paper describes a new approach to solve a problem of packing circles into a given rectangular area. In our problem setting, we assume that the circles have different diameters and the number of circles is above one hundred. Starting from random allocation of circles in relatively large rectangular area, by giving external force, we vibrate the circles and obtain more dense allocation. Elasticity is assumed in resulting forces by collision between the circles. The circles will continue to collide with each other while changing their positions continually. While the circles being vibrated, the rectangular area will be shrunk to minimize resulting waste. Final positions of the circles and the size of the rectangle will be determined when the circles cease to move. To obtain effective vibration to move the circles, we give the vibration according to Lissajous's figures and we tune the parameters of the figures using Genetic Algorithms. Magnitudes of amplitude, frequency and phase of the figures are encoded as artificial chromosomes and manipulated by conventional genetic operators. In the paper, we carry out some simulation basis experiments, and examine the applicability of the proposed methodology.
description.en: This paper describes a new approach to solve a problem of packing circles into a given rectangular area. In our problem setting, we assume that the circles have different diameters and the number of circles is above one hundred. Starting from random allocation of circles in relatively large rectangular area, by giving external force, we vibrate the circles and obtain more dense allocation. Elasticity is assumed in resulting forces by collision between the circles. The circles will continue to collide with each other while changing their positions continually. While the circles being vibrated, the rectangular area will be shrunk to minimize resulting waste. Final positions of the circles and the size of the rectangle will be determined when the circles cease to move. To obtain effective vibration to move the circles, we give the vibration according to Lissajous's figures and we tune the parameters of the figures using Genetic Algorithms. Magnitudes of amplitude, frequency and phase of the figures are encoded as artificial chromosomes and manipulated by conventional genetic operators. In the paper, we carry out some simulation basis experiments, and examine the applicability of the proposed methodology.

paper_title.en: Evolving Strategy for Packing Circles into a Pectangle : GA-Based Parameter Tuning for Controlling External Vibration Force
A Co-evolutionary Model for Jobshop Scheduling : An Experimental Study of a Multipe-Project Type Problem
Improving job-shop scheduling performance by adding bottleneck-finding parasites

description.en: This paper deals with a Host-Parasite type coevolutionary model for job-shop scheduling problems. In this model, a 'host' is a solution of the problem, i.e. schedule. A 'parasite' detects the bottleneck which is an obstacle to improvement of the host, and operates on its host. The parasite is activated when the host population converges, and helps the host escape local minima The model is formulated and its implementation is discussed Computer simulations are carried out, applicability of the proposed methodology is examined and effectiveness of the parasite is discussed.

paper_title.en: A mobile agents approach to large scale block stacking problem

description.en: In this paper, the result of applying a distributed approach to large scale block stacking problems is shown. In the approach, each block is a mobile autonomous agent and solutions of the problems are obtained as a result of local interactions among the agents. The interactions are mediated by motivation values which evaluate agents' mobility with respect to individual goal attainment. Each agent has a built-in ANN behavior function which is trained by an EP technique. The training is carried out using small size problems and then, by applying the result, large scale problems up to one thousand blocks are solved.

paper_title.en: Training Mobile Agent to Solve Cellular Maze Problem : An ANN Based Approach

publication_name.en: Proceedings of Intelligent Autonomous Systes 5(IOS Press)

paper_title.en: A conflict resolution algorithm for cellular warehouse problem

description.en: An approach to conflict resolution for cellular warehouse problem is shown. The solution of the problem is acquired as motion sequences to attain given goals for the transport tables. In the proposed approach, the tables are considered to be autonomous agents and navigate toward given goals avoiding other stable/moving tables according to requests for loading and unloading. Task-oriented ANN based behavior functions for the agents are evolved using a constructive method and Evolutionary Programming. Through local interactions between the agents, reactivation and deadlock problems are solved. An applicability of the approach is shown empirically.

paper_title.en: Packing circles under variable spatial constraints: A vibration control approach

description.en: This study propose a new approach to packing different-sized circles into given constrained areas. The constrained areas can be variable; i.e. either rectangular or circular, and the shapes and sizes are changeable. To solve the problem, a new approach method which mimics human shake actions is adopted. To obtain effective vibration to move the circles in the given container, the vibration is given according to Lissajous's figures. The parameters of the figures are tuned using Evolutionary Programming(EP) technique. In the paper, some simulation-basis experiments are carried out, and applicability of the proposed methodology is shown. The experimental results show adaptive characteristics of the proposed approach.

research_project_title.ja: 地図情報システムを用いた情報教育における精度の高い授業評価システムの構築
research_project_title.en: The reliable class evaluation system which is usable by information education using the GIS

offer_organization.en: Japan Society for the Promotion of Science

description.ja:
大学における情報教育は、高等学校で教科「情報」が必修授業として実施されるようになってからも改善が見られない。その上、大学入学生のコンピュータ操作の習熟度の差が広がり、大学における情報教育を一層困難なものにしている。
本研究ではこれらの現状を改善することを目的として、GISを用いたリアルタイム授業評価システムの構築を行うとともに、評価システムそのものに高い信頼度を付加した。GISを用いたことにより、学生の授業評価についての分析結果を地形図を見るように表現することが可能となった。その結果、情報教育の習熟度を改善することに寄与できた。
description.en:
Information technology (IT) literacy in college student , is not improvement in spite of IT education have been enhanced in the high school. In addition, IT literacy between students was spread more.
The purpose of our study is to improve the IT literacy of college students. Therefor we constructed a real-time class evaluation system using GIS. By using the GIS, it could be represented by analyzing the immediate understanding of the student. By can correspond immediately to the analysis results , it was possible to improve the IT literacy of university students .
